com.tectonica.jonix.codelist

Enum ProductFormDetails

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<ProductFormDetails>
      • com.tectonica.jonix.codelist.ProductFormDetails
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparable<ProductFormDetails>

    public enum ProductFormDetails
extends Enum<ProductFormDetails>
    Enum that corresponds to ONIX Codelist 78

    Description: Product form detail

    See Also:
    ONIX Codelists

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      _16_10
      Use for fixed-format e-books optimised for displays with a 16:10 aspect ratio (eg 1440x900, 2560x1600 pixels etc).
      _16_9
      Use for fixed-format e-books optimised for displays with a 16:9 aspect ratio (eg 1024x576, 1920x1080, 2048x1152 pixels etc).
      _3_2
      Use for fixed-format e-books optimised for displays with a 3:2 aspect ratio (eg 960x640, 3072x2048 pixels etc).
      _4_3
      Use for fixed-format e-books optimised for displays with a 4:3 aspect ratio (eg 800x600, 1024x768, 2048x1536 pixels etc).
      _46_Henkei_size
      Japanese format.
      _46_size
      Japanese format: 188x127mm.
      _5_4
      Use for fixed-format e-books optimised for displays with a 5:4 aspect ratio (eg 1280x1024 pixels etc, assuming square pixels).

      (aka ‘Star’ book).

      • Standalone_audio

        public static final ProductFormDetails Standalone_audio

      • Readalong_audio

        public static final ProductFormDetails Readalong_audio
        Audio intended exclusively for use alongside a printed copy of the book. Most often a children’s product. Normally contains instructions such as “turn the page now” and other references to the printed item, and is usually sold packaged together with a printed copy.

      • Playalong_audio

        public static final ProductFormDetails Playalong_audio
        Audio intended for musical accompaniment, eg ‘Music minus one’, etc, often used for music learning. Includes singalong backing audio for musical learning or for Karaoke-style entertainment.

      • Speakalong_audio

        public static final ProductFormDetails Speakalong_audio
        Audio intended for language learning, which includes speech plus gaps intended to be filled by the listener.

      • Synchronised_audio

        public static final ProductFormDetails Synchronised_audio
        Audio synchronised to text within an e-publication, for example an EPUB3 with audio overlay. Synchronisation at least at paragraph level, and covering the full content.

      • Mass_market_rack

        public static final ProductFormDetails Mass_market_rack
        In North America, a category of paperback characterized partly by page size (typically 4¼ x 7 1/8 inches) and partly by target market and terms of trade. Use with Product Form code BC.

      • Trade_paperback_US

        public static final ProductFormDetails Trade_paperback_US
        In North America, a category of paperback characterized partly by page size and partly by target market and terms of trade. AKA ‘quality paperback’, and including textbooks. Most paperback books sold in North America except ‘mass-market’ (B101) and ‘tall rack’ (B107) are correctly described with this code. Use with Product Form code BC.

      • Digest_format_paperback

        public static final ProductFormDetails Digest_format_paperback
        In North America, a category of paperback characterized by page size and generally used for children’s books; use with Product Form code BC. Note: was wrongly shown as B102 (duplicate entry) in Issue 3.

        public static final ProductFormDetails A_format_paperback
        In UK, a category of paperback characterized by page size (normally 178 x 111 mm approx); use with Product Form code BC.

        A book whose pages have a variety of textured inserts designed to stimulate tactile exploration: see also B214 and B215.

      • Toy_die_cut_book

        public static final ProductFormDetails Toy_die_cut_book
        DEPRECATED – use B212 or B213 as appropriate.

      • Die_cut_book

        public static final ProductFormDetails Die_cut_book
        A book which is cut into a distinctive non-rectilinear shape and/or in which holes or shapes have been cut internally. (‘Die-cut’ is used here as a convenient shorthand, and does not imply strict limitation to a particular production process.).

      • Book_as_toy

        public static final ProductFormDetails Book_as_toy
        A book which is also a toy, or which incorporates a toy as an integral part. (Do not, however, use B213 for a multiple-item product which includes a book and a toy as separate items.).

      • Soft_to_touch_book

        public static final ProductFormDetails Soft_to_touch_book
        A book whose cover has a soft textured finish, typically over board.

      • Fuzzy_felt_book

        public static final ProductFormDetails Fuzzy_felt_book
        A book with detachable felt pieces and textured pages on which they can be arranged.

      • Picture_book

        public static final ProductFormDetails Picture_book
        Children’s picture book: use with applicable Product Form code.

      • _Carousel_book

        public static final ProductFormDetails _Carousel_book
        (aka ‘Star’ book). Tax treatment of products may differ from that of products with similar codes such as Book as toy or Pop-up book).

      • Loose_leaf_sheets_and_binder

        public static final ProductFormDetails Loose_leaf_sheets_and_binder
        Use with Product Form code BD.

      • Loose_leaf_binder_only

        public static final ProductFormDetails Loose_leaf_binder_only
        Use with Product Form code BD.

      • Loose_leaf_sheets_only

        public static final ProductFormDetails Loose_leaf_sheets_only
        Use with Product Form code BD.

      • Sewn

        public static final ProductFormDetails Sewn
        AKA stitched; for ‘saddle-sewn’, see code B310.

      • Unsewn_adhesive_bound

        public static final ProductFormDetails Unsewn_adhesive_bound
        Including ‘perfect bound’, ‘glued’.

      • Library_binding

        public static final ProductFormDetails Library_binding
        Strengthened cloth-over-boards binding intended for libraries: use with Product form code BB.

      • Reinforced_binding

        public static final ProductFormDetails Reinforced_binding
        Strengthened binding, not specifically intended for libraries.

      • Half_bound

        public static final ProductFormDetails Half_bound
        Must be accompanied by a code specifiying a material, eg ‘half-bound real leather’.

      • Quarter_bound

        public static final ProductFormDetails Quarter_bound
        Must be accompanied by a code specifiying a material, eg ‘quarter bound real leather’.

      • Saddle_sewn

        public static final ProductFormDetails Saddle_sewn
        AKA ‘saddle-stitched’ or ‘wire-stitched’.

      • Comb_bound

        public static final ProductFormDetails Comb_bound
        Round or oval plastic forms in a clamp-like configuration: use with Product Form code BE.

      • Wire_O

        public static final ProductFormDetails Wire_O
        Twin loop metal wire spine: use with Product Form code BE.

      • Concealed_wire

        public static final ProductFormDetails Concealed_wire
        Cased over Coiled or Wire-O binding: use with Product Form code BE and Product Form Detail code B312 or B315.

      • Coiled_wire_bound

        public static final ProductFormDetails Coiled_wire_bound
        Spiral wire bound. Use with product form code BE. The default if a spiral binding type is not stated. Cf. Comb and Wire-O binding. <p>NOTE: Introduced in Onix3

      • Trade_binding

        public static final ProductFormDetails Trade_binding
        Hardcover binding intended for general consumers rather than libraries, use with Product form code BB. The default if a hardcover binding detail is not stated. cf. Library binding. <p>NOTE: Introduced in Onix3

      • Cloth_over_boards

        public static final ProductFormDetails Cloth_over_boards
        AKA fabric, linen over boards.

      • Paper_over_boards

        public static final ProductFormDetails Paper_over_boards

      • Leather_real

        public static final ProductFormDetails Leather_real

      • Leather_imitation

        public static final ProductFormDetails Leather_imitation

      • Leather_bonded

        public static final ProductFormDetails Leather_bonded

      • Vellum

        public static final ProductFormDetails Vellum

      • Plastic

        public static final ProductFormDetails Plastic
        DEPRECATED – use new B412 or B413 as appropriate.

      • Vinyl

        public static final ProductFormDetails Vinyl
        DEPRECATED – use new B412 or B414 as appropriate.

      • Cloth

        public static final ProductFormDetails Cloth
        Cloth, not necessarily over boards – cf B401.

      • Imitation_cloth

        public static final ProductFormDetails Imitation_cloth
        Spanish ‘simil-tela’.

      • Velvet

        public static final ProductFormDetails Velvet

      • Flexible_plastic_vinyl_cover

        public static final ProductFormDetails Flexible_plastic_vinyl_cover
        AKA ‘flexibound’: use with Product Form code BC.

      • Plastic_covered

        public static final ProductFormDetails Plastic_covered

      • Vinyl_covered

        public static final ProductFormDetails Vinyl_covered

      • Laminated_cover

        public static final ProductFormDetails Laminated_cover
        Book, laminating material unspecified: use L101 for ‘whole product laminated’, eg a laminated sheet map or wallchart.

      • With_dust_jacket

        public static final ProductFormDetails With_dust_jacket
        Type unspecified.

      • With_printed_dust_jacket

        public static final ProductFormDetails With_printed_dust_jacket
        Used to distinguish from B503.

      • With_translucent_dust_cover

        public static final ProductFormDetails With_translucent_dust_cover
        With translucent paper or plastic protective cover.

      • With_flaps

        public static final ProductFormDetails With_flaps
        For paperback with flaps.

      • With_thumb_index

        public static final ProductFormDetails With_thumb_index

      • With_ribbon_marker_s

        public static final ProductFormDetails With_ribbon_marker_s
        If the number of markers is significant, it can be stated as free text in <ProductFormDescription>.

      • With_zip_fastener

        public static final ProductFormDetails With_zip_fastener

      • With_button_snap_fastener

        public static final ProductFormDetails With_button_snap_fastener

      • With_leather_edge_lining

        public static final ProductFormDetails With_leather_edge_lining
        AKA yapp edge?.

      • Rough_front

        public static final ProductFormDetails Rough_front
        With edge trimming such that the front edge is ragged, not neatly and squarely trimmed: AKA deckle edge, feather edge, uncut edge, rough cut.

      • With_foldout

        public static final ProductFormDetails With_foldout
        With one or more gatefold or foldout sections bound in.

      • Wide_margin

        public static final ProductFormDetails Wide_margin
        Pages include extra-wide margin specifically intended for hand-written annotations.

      • With_fastening_strap

        public static final ProductFormDetails With_fastening_strap
        Book with attached loop for fixing to baby stroller, cot, chair etc. <p>NOTE: Introduced in Onix3

      • Turn_around_book

        public static final ProductFormDetails Turn_around_book
        A book in which half the content is printed upside-down, to be read the other way round. Also known as a ‘flip-book’, ‘back-to-back’, (fr.) ‘tête-bêche’ (usually an omnibus of two works).

      • Unflipped_manga_format

        public static final ProductFormDetails Unflipped_manga_format
        Manga with pages and panels in the sequence of the original Japanese, but with Western text.

      • Syllabification

        public static final ProductFormDetails Syllabification
        Text shows syllable breaks.

      • UK_Uncontracted_Braille

        public static final ProductFormDetails UK_Uncontracted_Braille
        Single letters only. Was formerly identified as UK Braille Grade 1.

      • UK_Contracted_Braille

        public static final ProductFormDetails UK_Contracted_Braille
        With some letter combinations. Was formerly identified as UK Braille Grade 2.

      • US_Braille

        public static final ProductFormDetails US_Braille
        DEPRECATED- use B704/B705 as appropriate instead.

      • US_Uncontracted_Braille

        public static final ProductFormDetails US_Uncontracted_Braille

      • US_Contracted_Braille

        public static final ProductFormDetails US_Contracted_Braille

        public static final ProductFormDetails Unified_English_Braille

      • Moon

        public static final ProductFormDetails Moon
        Moon embossed alphabet, used by some print-impaired readers who have difficulties with Braille.

        Includes RealVideo packaged within a .rm RealMedia container.

      • Reflowable

        public static final ProductFormDetails Reflowable
        Use where a particular e-publication type (specified in <EpubType>) has both reflowable and fixed-format variants.

      • Fixed_format

        public static final ProductFormDetails Fixed_format
        Use where a particular e-publication type (specified in <EpubType>) has both reflowable and fixed-format variants.

      • Readable_offline

        public static final ProductFormDetails Readable_offline
        All e-publication resources are included within the e-publication package.

      • Requires_network_connection

        public static final ProductFormDetails Requires_network_connection
        E-publication requires a network connection to access some resources (eg an enhanced e-book where video clips are not stored within the e-publication ‘package’ itself, but are delivered via an internet connection).

      • Content_removed

        public static final ProductFormDetails Content_removed
        Resources (eg images) present in other editions have been removed from this product, eg due to rights issues.

      • Landscape

        public static final ProductFormDetails Landscape
        Use for fixed-format e-books optimised for landscape display. Also include an indication of the optimal screen aspect ratio.

      • Portrait

        public static final ProductFormDetails Portrait
        Use for fixed-format e-books optimised for portrait display. Also include an indication of the optimal screen aspect ratio.

      • _5_4

        public static final ProductFormDetails _5_4
        Use for fixed-format e-books optimised for displays with a 5:4 aspect ratio (eg 1280x1024 pixels etc, assuming square pixels). Note that aspect ratio codes are NOT specific to actual screen dimensions or pixel counts, but to the ratios between two dimensions or two pixel counts.

      • _4_3

        public static final ProductFormDetails _4_3
        Use for fixed-format e-books optimised for displays with a 4:3 aspect ratio (eg 800x600, 1024x768, 2048x1536 pixels etc).

      • _3_2

        public static final ProductFormDetails _3_2
        Use for fixed-format e-books optimised for displays with a 3:2 aspect ratio (eg 960x640, 3072x2048 pixels etc).

      • _16_10

        public static final ProductFormDetails _16_10
        Use for fixed-format e-books optimised for displays with a 16:10 aspect ratio (eg 1440x900, 2560x1600 pixels etc).

      • _16_9

        public static final ProductFormDetails _16_9
        Use for fixed-format e-books optimised for displays with a 16:9 aspect ratio (eg 1024x576, 1920x1080, 2048x1152 pixels etc).

      • Laminated

        public static final ProductFormDetails Laminated
        Whole product laminated (eg laminated map, fold-out chart, wallchart, etc): use B415 for book with laminated cover.

      • values

        public static ProductFormDetails[] values()
        Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared. This method may be used to iterate over the constants as follows: 
        for (ProductFormDetails c : ProductFormDetails.values())
    System.out.println(c);
        Returns:
        an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared

      • valueOf

        public static ProductFormDetails valueOf(String name)
        Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name. The string must match exactly an identifier used to declare an enum constant in this type. (Extraneous whitespace characters are not permitted.)
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the enum constant to be returned.
        Returns:
        the enum constant with the specified name
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if this enum type has no constant with the specified name
        NullPointerException - if the argument is null
